Key Arguments: The proposed legislation is seen as authoritarian and reminiscent of laws in socialist countries that suppress free speech.
The legislation is perceived as a threat to freedom of speech and democracy.
There is concern about who determines what is considered true or false information.
The legislation was not part of the government's election platform and lacks a democratic mandate.
